about_text.value: England and the Levant, late 12th century. A Templar knight crosses a line that history still debates.

text_script.value: You kneel before the Templar marshal. The vows are familiar and heavy.

prompt_script.value: You kneel before the Templar marshal. The vows are familiar and heavy.

text_script.value: Swear without hesitation.
The marshal nods once.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Ask for time to pray.
You seek clarity before the vow.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Steel and silence. The order is a machine made of men.

prompt_script.value: Steel and silence. The order is a machine made of men.

text_script.value: Embrace the discipline.
You become a clean edge.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Keep a private notebook.
You observe more than you say.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Share doubts with a companion.
You are not alone in the question.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Merchants speak of Saladin, of discipline and mercy, of a war turning.

prompt_script.value: Merchants speak of Saladin, of discipline and mercy, of a war turning.

text_script.value: Dismiss them as propaganda.
You focus on the order.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Listen carefully.
The world seems larger.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Ask the chaplain.
He warns against curiosity.
The moment bends in a different direction.
You are ordered east. The vow now has a destination.

prompt_script.value: You are ordered east. The vow now has a destination.

text_script.value: Go willingly.
You set your face toward the Levant.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Ask to remain in England.
The request is denied.
The moment bends in a different direction.
The coast recedes. Your homeland becomes a line on the horizon.

prompt_script.value: The coast recedes. Your homeland becomes a line on the horizon.

text_script.value: Pray for strength.
You feel steadier.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Sharpen your sword.
You focus on the tangible.
The moment bends in a different direction.
A storm scatters ships. You grip the rail and promise whatever you must.

prompt_script.value: A storm scatters ships. You grip the rail and promise whatever you must.

text_script.value: Promise a pilgrimage if you live.
The vow may bind you later.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Promise to obey the order without question.
You lean into duty.
The moment bends in a different direction.
The Levant is dust, heat, and distance. The war is no longer a story.

prompt_script.value: The Levant is dust, heat, and distance. The war is no longer a story.

text_script.value: Visit a local church.
You seek familiar ground.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Scout the enemy fortifications.
You measure the task ahead.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Rations are thin. Horses go hungry before men.

prompt_script.value: Rations are thin. Horses go hungry before men.

text_script.value: Share your portion.
Compassion costs you.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Keep what you need.
You survive, but feel it.
The moment bends in a different direction.
A messenger asks if you want to send news.

prompt_script.value: A messenger asks if you want to send news.

text_script.value: Write a simple letter.
You anchor yourself in memory.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Say nothing.
You keep the war to yourself.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Your first skirmish leaves a man dead at your feet. You cannot unsee it.

prompt_script.value: Your first skirmish leaves a man dead at your feet. You cannot unsee it.

text_script.value: Pray for him.
You soften without yielding.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Harden yourself.
You feel the armor close.
The moment bends in a different direction.
A city holds. Hunger grows in both camps.

prompt_script.value: A city holds. Hunger grows in both camps.

text_script.value: Push for an assault.
You choose speed over caution.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Hold and negotiate.
You choose patience.
The moment bends in a different direction.
You are ordered to guard prisoners. Some are children.

prompt_script.value: You are ordered to guard prisoners. Some are children.

text_script.value: Treat them with basic dignity.
The order notices.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Follow strict orders.
You do not make yourself a target.
The moment bends in a different direction.
An Ayyubid envoy speaks of terms, honor, and the cost of pride.

prompt_script.value: An Ayyubid envoy speaks of terms, honor, and the cost of pride.

text_script.value: Hear him out.
His words linger.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Reject him publicly.
You shore up the order?s stance.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Ask for proof of mercy.
He mentions past exchanges.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Disease follows hunger. Morale starts to crack.

prompt_script.value: Disease follows hunger. Morale starts to crack.

text_script.value: Ration for the sick first.
You trade strength for conscience.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Keep combat strength high.
You prioritize the order?s survival.
The moment bends in a different direction.
A fellow knight asks if the cause still makes sense.

prompt_script.value: A fellow knight asks if the cause still makes sense.

text_script.value: Tell him to hold the line.
You carry the doubt for both of you.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Admit your doubts.
The honesty costs you sleep.
The moment bends in a different direction.
A truce fails. The blame is shared, the consequence is not.

prompt_script.value: A truce fails. The blame is shared, the consequence is not.

text_script.value: Accept the necessity of war.
You lean into expediency.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Question the order.
You feel the ground shift.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Commanders argue about the march. You are asked to speak.

prompt_script.value: Commanders argue about the march. You are asked to speak.

text_script.value: Support the aggressive plan.
Your name gains weight.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Advise caution.
You are heard but not followed.
The moment bends in a different direction.
A sudden raid leaves you separated. You meet an Ayyubid patrol.

prompt_script.value: A sudden raid leaves you separated. You meet an Ayyubid patrol.

text_script.value: Fight your way out.
You escape but lose men.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Surrender to live.
You are taken alive.
The moment bends in a different direction.
In a tent, you are offered water and a chance to speak freely.

prompt_script.value: In a tent, you are offered water and a chance to speak freely.

text_script.value: Refuse to speak.
Silence holds, for now.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Speak honestly.
Honesty becomes its own risk.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Ask about Saladin.
You hear the name without anger.
The moment bends in a different direction.
An envoy suggests you could live differently, even here.

prompt_script.value: An envoy suggests you could live differently, even here.

text_script.value: Reject it.
You remain a Templar.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Ask for time.
You do not close the door.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Accept conversation.
You listen to a different account of the war.
The moment bends in a different direction.
The lines blur. You are returned, or you are kept. Either way, you are changed.

prompt_script.value: The lines blur. You are returned, or you are kept. Either way, you are changed.

text_script.value: Reaffirm the order.
You tighten your identity.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Let the doubt remain.
You carry a private fracture.
The moment bends in a different direction.
You are offered a place among the Ayyubids. It would mean leaving the Order.

prompt_script.value: You are offered a place among the Ayyubids. It would mean leaving the Order.

text_script.value: Remain a Templar.
You keep your vows.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Convert and join Saladin?s camp.
You choose a new allegiance.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Delay and negotiate.
You buy time but lose clarity.
The moment bends in a different direction.
You fight under new orders?or old ones?depending on your choice.

prompt_script.value: You fight under new orders?or old ones?depending on your choice.

text_script.value: Serve with discipline.
You learn a different command language.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Keep your conscience close.
You avoid needless cruelty.
The moment bends in a different direction.
The heat is merciless. The crusader line breaks.

prompt_script.value: The heat is merciless. The crusader line breaks.

text_script.value: Press the attack.
You do what the field demands.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Spare those who surrender.
Mercy travels faster than orders.
The moment bends in a different direction.
The city stands, then falls. Stories harden into legend.

prompt_script.value: The city stands, then falls. Stories harden into legend.

text_script.value: Believe the legend being told about you.
You step into a story larger than yourself.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Resist the legend.
You remain a man, not a tale.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Stories say you promised Jerusalem, married into Saladin's family, and were made a prince. Others call it a fairy tale.

prompt_script.value: Stories say you promised Jerusalem, married into Saladin's family, and were made a prince. Others call it a fairy tale.

text_script.value: Let the rumor stand.
The legend grows.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Correct the record.
The truth is smaller, and heavier.
The moment bends in a different direction.
You fight and travel in a land that will not forget you.

prompt_script.value: You fight and travel in a land that will not forget you.

text_script.value: Keep faith with your choice.
You carry it to the end.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Wish you had chosen differently.
The doubt never quite leaves.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Your life is now a set of claims and counterclaims.

prompt_script.value: Your life is now a set of claims and counterclaims.

text_script.value: Accept the ambiguity.
History will decide.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Write your own account.
You refuse to be rewritten.
The moment bends in a different direction.
You remain within the Templar story-duty, obedience, and silence.

prompt_script.value: You remain within the Templar story-duty, obedience, and silence.

text_script.value: You convert and fight beside Saladin. To some you are a traitor; to others, a man who saw the war differently.

prompt_script.value: You convert and fight beside Saladin. To some you are a traitor; to others, a man who saw the war differently.

text_script.value: You convert, but doubt never stops following you. You are neither fully inside nor outside.

prompt_script.value: You convert, but doubt never stops following you. You are neither fully inside nor outside.

text_script.value: You die in the field in 1187, one more body in a war that will be remembered.

prompt_script.value: You die in the field in 1187, one more body in a war that will be remembered.

text_script.value: Rumor makes you a prince and a promise-keeper. In the end, your former crusader brothers strike you down as you whisper ?la ilaha ill Allah.?

prompt_script.value: Rumor makes you a prince and a promise-keeper. In the end, your former crusader brothers strike you down as you whisper ?la ilaha ill Allah.?

text_script.value: Two accounts follow you. One paints you as a prince by marriage; another insists you were only a renegade soldier.

prompt_script.value: Two accounts follow you. One paints you as a prince by marriage; another insists you were only a renegade soldier.

text_script.value: Stand with the court chroniclers.
The order keeps its version.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Trust later historians.
Certainty frays around the edges.
The moment bends in a different direction.
Leave the record unfinished.
You turn away from the page.
The moment bends in a different direction.
You vanish from the record, trading oath and name for a quiet margin.

prompt_script.value: You vanish from the record, trading oath and name for a quiet margin.

text_script.value: In Aleppo you hear Suhrawardi speak on light. He raises a sapphire, names it, then?whether parable or performance?smashes it and says the light remains.

prompt_script.value: In Aleppo you hear Suhrawardi speak on light. He raises a sapphire, names it, then?whether parable or performance?smashes it and says the light remains.

text_script.value: Hear the lesson of light and return.
The words cling to you as you leave.
You pocket a shard and keep quiet.
Challenge the jurists and insist the light is real.
The room turns; a reversal is felt.
You are warned, but the lesson deepens.
You are brought before Salah al-Din. Mercy and order are both on the table.

prompt_script.value: You are brought before Salah al-Din. Mercy and order are both on the table.

text_script.value: Appeal to mercy and clemency.
He studies you, then softens.
He grants a narrow favor.
Argue for order and discipline.
He nods at the discipline.
He questions your motive.
You keep faith with Suhrawardi?s light, and his circle remembers your name.

prompt_script.value: You keep faith with Suhrawardi?s light, and his circle remembers your name.

text_script.value: Salah al-Din recognizes your steadiness, granting you a guarded place in his record.

prompt_script.value: Salah al-Din recognizes your steadiness, granting you a guarded place in his record.

text_script.value: You become an Ishraqi murid, taking the discipline of light as your true order.

prompt_script.value: You become an Ishraqi murid, taking the discipline of light as your true order.

text_script.value: You turn Suhrawardi over to his enemies. The court rewards your pragmatism and never trusts you again.

prompt_script.value: You turn Suhrawardi over to his enemies. The court rewards your pragmatism and never trusts you again.

text_script.value: You betray Salah al-Din at the edge of victory. The moment lasts; the consequences do not.

prompt_script.value: You betray Salah al-Din at the edge of victory. The moment lasts; the consequences do not.
